newsitem.title: USA: Broderbund sees Q2 results below forecasts.
newsitem.headline: Broderbund sees Q2 results below forecasts.

text.p: Broderbund Software Inc said Tuesday it expects to report earnings of between $0.15 and $0.20 per share excluding charges in the second quarter on sales of $41 to $44 million, which it said will be below analyst forecasts.
The consensus estimate for the company's second quarter net income is $0.31 per share, according to First Call.
The company said that while unit volume was up over 30 percent for the last three months, results were hurt by reduced prices.

Broderbund said second quarter earnings will also include charges associated with the acquisition of Living Books, the maker of educational software, which in January Broderbund reached an agreement to acquire.

In the year-ago second quarter, Broderbund reported second quarter earnings of $0.87 per share, or $0.45 after excluding gains it realized when its agreement to merge with The Learning Co were terminated.

Commenting on the latest forecast, Chief Executive Officer Joe Durrett said, "We believe the improvement in our business is still moving ahead, but it will probably take a few months longer than previously anticipated."
The company expects to report results on March 20.
Broderbund, which makes interactive software, has for the last few years relied heavily on the best-selling Myst mystery-adventure game to boost sales.
But sales of the game began falling sharply last year, as a rash of new products by competitors cut into Broderbund's market.
